column2: TEXAS DMV PRACTICE TEST
Question Text
1. This sign means:
column8: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 2. When driving on slick roads, drivers should:
column4: drive as they would on dry roads.

column2: 3. This sign means:
column4: the road may be slippery when wet.
column6: no turns are allowed on this road.

column2: 4. To reduce their chances of colliding with an animal, drivers should:
column4: Slow down when approaching animals that are standing near the road.
column6: look well down the road and far off to each side.
column8: scan the sides of the road to watch for the reflection of vehicle headlights in the eyes of animals.

column2: 5. The sign in the picture:
column4: indicates the minimum ramp speed at the highway exit point.
column6: shows the highest speed drivers can travel at the exit of the intersection.
column10: is used to advise motorists of the appropriate ramp speed at the highway exit point.

column2: 6. What are some telltale signs of a drunk driver?
column6: Driving slower than the normal flow of traffic.

column2: 7. What should you do if you see smoke come from under the hood?
column4: Jump off your car immediately, if it is safe to do so.
column6: Try to fight the fire yourself.
column8: Call the fire department and then pull off the road and park your vehicle.
column10: Pull off the road and park your vehicle. Turn off the ignition, get away from the car and call the fire department.

column2: 8. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column6: another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column8: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.
column10: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.

column2: 9. A driver should be extra alert for motorcyclists, bicycles and pedestrians. Why?
column6: They are hard to see in traffic.

column2: 10. What is the purpose of minimum speed limits?
column4: To keep a smooth traffic flow.
column8: To decrease the state average speed statistic.
column10: To allow emergency vehicles with red flashing lights to safely pass other vehicles.

column2: 11. When driving on major highways you should:
column8: be ready to react to road hazards.

column2: 12. Which shape is a warning sign?
13. Your blind spot is the area of the road:
column4: you see in your rearview mirror.
column6: you cannot see without moving your head.
column10: you see in your side mirror.

column2: 14. Never make a U-turn from:
column4: the left part of the lane nearest to the centerline of the roadway.

column2: 15. You must come to a full stop at a yield sign:
column8: Before you decrease speed and reach the intersection.

column2: 16. Alcohol:
column4: makes you less aware of what is happening to your driving abilities.
column8: enhances your ability to see clearly.
column10: makes it easier to make correct decisions.

column2: 17. A red traffic sign means?
18. This sign means:
column10: You must yield the right-of-way ahead

column2: 19. You should never depend on your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes. Why?
column6: Mirrors leave “blind spots” behind both sides of vehicles.
column8: You should look over your shoulder instead.

column2: 20. The driver of an emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can legally:
21. A steady yellow light means:
column6: Stop, yield the right-of-way, and go.
column8: Be prepared to stop for the red light.
column10: Be prepared to go. The light will soon be green.

column2: 22. When you approach this sign, you must:
column6: watch for workers crossing the road.

column2: 23. What should you do as you prepare to turn right at an intersection?
column4: Signal your turn, check for bicyclists, and do not turn directly in front of a bicyclist.
column8: Yield to bicyclists coming from the opposite direction.

column2: 24. When changing lanes, you should:
column4: check your mirrors, signal and change lanes.
column6: signal, change lanes and check your mirrors.
column10: signal, check your mirrors and blind spot in the direction you plan to move, then change lanes.

column2: 25. For protection, motorcyclists are required to:
column6: signal turns, lane changes and stops.
column8: keep their headlights and taillights on at all times.

column2: 26. A driver approaching a flashing red traffic signal must:
column4: slow down at the traffic signal.
column10: carefully drive through the intersection without stopping.

column2: 27. Alcohol:
column4: makes it difficult for drivers to judge their condition.
column8: makes drivers more prone to take chances.

column2: 28. Drivers may pass another vehicle if the line dividing two lanes is a ________ line.
29. This road sign means:
30. When driving in bad weather, drivers should:
column4: increase their speed to get to their destination more quickly.
